law.catch_line: A Board of Directors shall manage the affairs of the Corporation and exercise all of the powers of t...

text.section: A Board of Directors shall manage the affairs of the Corporation and exercise all of the powers of the Corporation.

The Board consists of the following 18 members:
as ex officio voting members:
the Secretary;
the Executive Director of the Maryland Economic Development Corporation; and
the Executive Director of the Washington County Economic Development Commission; and
fifteen members appointed by the County Commissioners.

section.section: The term of an appointed member of the Board is 4 years.
The terms of appointed members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 2008.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed.
